summary: This is an email from a Program Manager at Convergint Federal (SigNet Technologies) to an unspecified recipient, discussing the delayed installation of surveillance gear at MCC New York. The gear was ordered in September 2018 but could not be installed until after an unspecified 'incident' because IP addresses were not provided. The document is part of the Epstein case files, suggesting it relates to security or monitoring at the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

keyFacts: Surveillance/security gear was ordered for MCC New York on September 21, 2018, and delivered approximately 30 days later.
Installation of the gear was stalled because the necessary IP addresses were never provided by the site (MCC NY).
The gear was only installed 'after the incident,' implying a significant event at the facility prompted the completion of the installation.
The correspondence is from a contractor (Convergint Federal/SigNet Technologies) to the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP), discussing logistical issues.
The document is dated October 1, 2021, which is over two years after Jeffrey Epstein's death in MCC New York custody in August 2019, suggesting a review or inquiry into facility procedures.
